sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: mailnag is a Wayland e-mail notification daemon. It integrates well with mako and libnotify and comes with interactive configuration tooling, making setup very straight-forward.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: mailnag can be installed with the mailnag package.

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content: Run mailnag-config to create an initial configuration at ~/.config/mailnag/mailnag.cfg.

sections.title: Usage
sections.content: Users can run mailnag from within a shell while running a Wayland or Xorg session, given that a notification daemon is running.

sections.title: Autostart
sections.content: mailnag supports XDG Autostart out of the box. A systemd user service example has been included below as another option.

sections.title: systemd user unit
sections.content:
Users will probably want to run mailnag in a systemd unit. Provided below is an example user unit where user id is the numeric ID of the user where this service is installed.

```
~/.config/system/user/mailnag.service
```

```
[Unit]
Description=Mailnag notification service

[Service]
ExecStart=/usr/bin/mailnag

[Install]
WantedBy=default.target
```

Then start mailnag.service.

sections.title: XDG
sections.content: The mailnag package provides a /usr/share/applications/mailnag.desktop file for use with XDG Autostart that is supported by various desktop environments.
